forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny, with a high near 66. West southwest wind around 23 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 58. Southwest wind 5 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph.

weather_report:
The atmosphere over Downtown San Francisco this evening is a harmonious blend of fading daylight and a gentle breeze. The sun, having made its journey across the sky, leaves behind a bright clarity, now softening as twilight descends. With a high earlier today flirting close to 66 degrees, the warmth lingers but is met with a hint of chill typical of the city at this hour. Gusts from the southwest, dancing at speeds of up to 29 mph, add a lively character to the evening, encouraging a light layer to keep at bay the coolness coming in off the ocean.

As the day transitions, the likelihood of fog forming diminishes, though the classic San Francisco marine layer may still be nestled closer to the coast, perhaps obscuring the Golden Gate Bridge just enough to evoke a sense of whimsy. In the heart of the city, the visibility remains good, offering excellent opportunities for an evening stroll along the Embarcadero or a quiet moment in one of the many peaceful parks. Light jackets or sweaters, perhaps accompanied by a scarf, will suit the evening's cool embrace nicely. It’s an inviting moment, perfect for sipping a warm drink at a café or observing the urban rhythm of life as day gives way to night.
